website_summaries.verdict: A good-looking instrument that delivers when it comes to sound, and is also an excellent value considering its lifetime warranty.
pros: Offers nice craftsmanship and rich sound thanks to Probucker 2 and 3 pickups
Most owners purchase to play as a mid-grade guitar but find it outperforms expectations
cons: Some complaints of scratching on the body and a small number of owners received guitars with electronic failures, but were able to return them.

customer_reviews.title: Get your Epiphone now....They will double their price one day.
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL.......This Guitar is Worth more than what you pay for. It does not have to say Gibson for me to Love it. The Quality of workmanship far surpasses all expectation. Why a Gibson cost more... "I will never know" This is my 4th Epiphone: One day they will be worth twice the price. Get yours now before it's too late. The Set up it comes with is top quality. This model "Standard Plus-Top Pro" is worth bragging about. My friends that Paid $$$ for their Gibson are covered with Envy.
customer_reviews.author: JOVENTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: This thing was packaged with great care from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I'm gonna be honest, my biggest concern when making this purchase was not build quality or how it compares to the Gibson but rather the shipping. This thing was packaged with great care from the manufacturer, and then boxed up again. It arrived in pristine condition, out of tune obviously but without a single blemish. Bought alongside an Orange Crush amp with a built-in tuner it stays in tune very well and only requires to be re-tuned every once in a while. My only regret is that I wish I'd bought it a few months ago when it was on sale and $150 cheaper but still worth every penny at the higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrard

customer_reviews.title: Good; but needs professional setup
customer_reviews.text: A pleasure to play! The only drawback isn't the guitar itself, but the fact that I purchased it online -- it doesn't arrive set up. The action was super high, the intonation was messed up, etc -- they don't come off the assembly line playable! If you buy one, you'll need to take it to a guitar tech for setup. (I ended up doing it myself by watching YouTube videos, but... )
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted a Les Paul for a few years but didn't want to spend Gibson dollars. I decided to go for it but then after reading the great Epiphone reviews I pulled the trigger on the Plus Top Pro. Beautiful guitar. Set-up by Gibson and then sent to me. I have 7 guitars and a couple are fairly expensive. This is my favorite after playing it for a few months. I will say that the treble/rhythm switch was not working properly when I received it but a call to Gibson and they sent a replacement guickly. I doubt you can buy a finer guitar for the money.
customer_reviews.author: david bunch

customer_reviews.title: Epiphone Rocks
customer_reviews.text: What a great Les Paul. Everything you would want in a LP Standard at a cost most could afford. Epiphone is a Gibson company and these guitars are inspected and set up by Gibson. If you are just a amateur guitar player like I am, this is the way to go. The looks, feel and sound of this guitar is amazing. Just check out the reviews on line. In the end I would say, go for what ever makes you happy.
customer_reviews.author: ucandoit

customer_reviews.title: Best electric guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: Intermediate player myself, but an instructor recommended this model. Solid build, good setup out of the box and beautiful finish. Amazon double boxed it with spacers between inner/outer box. 2-day delivery with prime. I’m very happy and I recommend this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: coben

customer_reviews.title: Rivals Any Gibson LP
customer_reviews.text: Flawless in every way! The finish and wood grain on this guitar are absolutely gorgeous. The quality is every bit as high as any Gibson I've seen. The guitar came set up, but the action was a bit high for me so I took it to a local Luthier and had it lowered. I also changed the strings to a lighter gage. It chords so easily and is so sweet to play. The sound it puts out rivals any Gibson I've seen. And the sustain - it goes on and on. Epiphone has upped their game and the guitars being made today are not your father's tinny sounding Epi's.
customer_reviews.author: M42

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about ordering a guitar through Amazon, especially one I had never played before. No regrets - this guitar is beautiful, and sounds excellent! Guitar arrived in great shape, and was packaged perfectly. It has that “new guitar” smell going on too - it’s intoxicating! Feels great, sounds great, looks awesome - what more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Christian Najera

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! This baby really rocks. I know it's not supposed to be as good as a Gibson but for the recreational guitar player this is awesome. The tuners are very nice. Who knows if it will stand up to 300 concert dates a year but I won't need to know that.The thing just sounds awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous guitar and plays beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful guitar, picture does NOT do it justice! Color is Wine Red and the flame maple top is gorgeous!! No setup at all needed, it was ready to play. No action adjustment needed, no truss rod adjustment needed, no intonation needed, no pickup adjustment needed... Tuned her up, plugged it in and shook (All Night Long) the walls and windows!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cris Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful machine
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I had anticipated. I agonized about the decision for a long time and did a lot of research and I am very pleased with it. Everything feels very solid. I tried a few Gideon's at GC and there was no noticeable difference for me. In actual fact I preferred the meck on the epi much more than the Gibson. At a quarter of the price this is great buy. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy this?
customer_reviews.text: Just received this guitar today so I can't speak to durability issues, but it arrived in perfect condition, with perfect intonation and a flawless finish. This guitar was assembled in China and then inspected and set up in the U.S. It is lovely to look at but the range and power and beauty of its tone took my breath away. I never imagined it could be so sensitive along with being such a powerhouse and sustain monster. It is everything I ever dreamed of having in an electric guitar. I recently bought a MIM Strat from Amazon as well and both guitars are superstars. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: ... Pro with no problems - came well packaged in perfect condition. It's a beautiful guitar & sounds awesome
customer_reviews.text: Recieved my Epiphone Les Paul Standard-Top Pro with no problems - came well packaged in perfect condition. It's a beautiful guitar & sounds awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I really like this guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this guitar and had issues with it but the people at Gibson-Epiphone were very kind to replace it. I like this guitar. --- OLD REVIEW: 3 stars I ordered this guitar ten days ago; the guitar arrived on time but it has small imperfections, and the bridge tone knob is visually cracked and doesn't work. I contacted Gibson, and they took six days to reply. At this moment, I am requesting a replacement at Amazon. Besides my negative experience, the guitar looks excellent for being only $549. I bought it because of its nearly-perfect reviews here. I will update this review after receiving the replacement guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Sciencia

customer_reviews.title: The guitar did come with about 12 scratches in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The guitar did come with about 12 scratches in the clear coat, but it was not worth the hassle of a return.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: but it's beautiful and sounds pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I'm brand new to playing, so I don't have a ton to compare it to, but it's beautiful and sounds pretty good. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Massey

customer_reviews.title: Epiphone Les Paul
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar for the money. Pickups sound great and after a quick rewire job, it's hard to tell it apart from the more expensive American version.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful guitar. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful guitar. Good quality. The low E does not want to stay tuned, slightly off pitch. Still sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Parag Magunia

customer_reviews.title: After receiving the guitar I would have paid the full price BUT so glad I didn't
customer_reviews.text: This was all I was expecting and more. When I found this on Warehouse Deals for $300, it was a no brainer. After receiving the guitar I would have paid the full price BUT so glad I didn't. This is worth every penny. The craftsmanship is flawless. It's actually much better looking in person. I pared this up with a Fender Mustang II amp (which is a killer amp for $200). So for $500 I'm all set up and enjoying life. Rock on!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mielke

customer_reviews.title: Best Guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the best guitar available for the price. I love it I play it through a Fender Mustang 3. AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Dr. T

customer_reviews.title: Was a good buy for sure
customer_reviews.text: Very playable right out the box. Action is just right, and the hardware holds tune very well. Was a good buy for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of the Epiphone, and it sounds great. I'm just a beginner, but it's perfect for me. Very Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I Watkins

customer_reviews.title: This is a great guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guitar for the money. I'm an amateur guitar player and this meets all of my needs and more. Love the feel, sound and color combo. I'm very pleased with this purchase and am now and Epiphone fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N.

customer_reviews.title: you have to get it
customer_reviews.text: the picture does to do justice this is a beautiful les paul with great sound quality you can't even tell its an epiphone
customer_reviews.author: so fun even better than flapping bird

customer_reviews.title: better than current gibsons.
customer_reviews.text: Plays great, looks great, has a comfortable neck, versatile pick-ups, resonates like a gibson.
customer_reviews.author: Martine Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Great Player, Look Great.
customer_reviews.text: I got mine from zZounds $500 or Pay As You Play Plan. Unreal as how it looks. The finish is beautiful, It plays and sounds great. The Pro Buckers are a good plus with the switching to a single coil if needed. The Grover tuners are a 14:1 I'd rather have the18:1 that's what I put on my guitars, but still a good upgrade. I think it looks a lot better without the pick guard, shows more of the detail in the wood. I changed out the strings to Elixir Super Lights Polywebs. The guitar stays in tune, looks great, easy player, and sounds great. Thinking about buying all the colors they make...just kidding... maybe...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Capasso

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: I think it's hard to beat this guitar for the price. It's well made, attractive, and plays well. Mine arrived well setup up right out of the box. The Plus Top adds a very nice veneer for very little additional cost, too. It would be hard to justify an additional $1,000 for the minor differences between this and the Gibson.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader in CA

customer_reviews.title: ... my girlfriend (parents also helped her purchase it) I love everything about this guitar
customer_reviews.text: I got this guitar as a birthday gift from my girlfriend (parents also helped her purchase it) I love everything about this guitar. I grew up loving the sun burst color but when I opened the box and saw that stark blue burst, I was stunned. This thing plays awesome. I think it would take a seasoned veteran to tell the difference between this and a Gibson les Paul and I bet even he/she would tell you it's a close call. I love the fact that you can pull up on the volume knobs and switch between single pickup and humbucker.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An awesome intermediate guitar! Feels great, looks beautiful, sounds like a dream. I love this guitar!
customer_reviews.author: setty17

customer_reviews.title: Worth the MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is great,though it is definitely not a Gibson Les Paul but for 500 dollars it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shannont1

product_meta.title: Epiphone Les Paul Standard PlusTop Pro Electric Guitar, Trans Blue
product_meta.description:
Out of all of Les Paul"s many achievements; inventor, guitarist, and hit recording artist, Les is most beloved among musicians for inspiring the Les Paul Standard, one of the most sought-after guitars in the world. And now, the Epiphone Les Paul Standard Plus top PRO give the legend a fresh start with ProBucker-2 and ProBucker-3 pickups with coil-tapping, a AAA flame maple veneer top, and beautiful new color options.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Epiphone
feature_bullets: Grover Machine Heads with 18:1 tuning ratio

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars83 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
